intro: Eurybia horrida, commonly known as the rough blueweed, is a perennial flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its hairy, gray-green foliage and showy blue or purple flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist to wet habitats such as swamps, bogs, and wet meadows. Its flowers bloom in late summer and early fall, attracting pollinators like bees and butterflies. Eurybia horrida is often found in the eastern United States and parts of Canada.
